children.text:
Up, Down, and Through V2!

"Up, Down, and Through" was my first level, dating back to within a couple days of joining the community. You may know it due to its presence in the community pack. The level attempted to make use of a very cool mechanic(see the puzzle wing for a hint) but failed miserably due to the existence of a shortcut. The new version of the level patches the shortcut and forces people to find the mechanic.

Execution difficulty: 3
Puzzle difficulty: 2
Challenge time: 20.000

Level 30!

This level is a pretty faithful imitation of level 30 from Boxel Rebound. I updated it when themes were added.

Execution difficulty: 7

Momentous!

This is a speed cube level loosely inspired by noobus's "Faster Than a Bullet"

Execution difficulty: 3
Challenge time: 10.000

The reason why all of the levels in is pack end in an exclamation point is because I didn't want the file names to be the same as those in Charlieee1's packs. If you have 2 levels of the same name, it's kind of buggy.

One at a time!

This is a decently long level that uses cube and platformer. The concept behind it is to progressively unlock more and more control over your movement. There's one tricky jump that I've received complaints about, (see puzzle wing for a hint) but I really couldn't think of something to replace it with.

Execution difficulty: 8
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Two at a time!

This level is the sequel to "One at a time!" It uses the concept of slowly unlocking more and more control of your movement in the same way. However, this one is with spider rather than platformer. There are more separate puzzle elements to this level than to "One at a time" (see puzzle wing for hints) but they are all easier than the one jump found in that level.

Execution difficulty: 8
Puzzle difficulty: 4

Inclement Weather!

This is a platformer level that turns natural disasters into obstacles. Here is a complete list of the disasters in the order that they appear:
-volcano
-earthquake
-flood
-wildfire
-landslide
-blizzard
-thunderstorm
-tornado

Execution difficulty: 5

Difficulty scales
The levels all have an Execution difficulty. This is how hard the level is to play assuming you know how it is supposed to be played. This scale is from 1-20.
Some levels have a Puzzle difficulty. These levels do not provide you with complete information about how you are supposed to play them. The puzzle difficulty scale measures how hard it is to figure this out. This scale is also 1-20.

Marble Mania!

This is an auto level, meaning it will beat itself for you if you don't bother using the controls. This is my most popular level according to the level vote tally. It is also pretty fun to speedrun.

Execution difficulty: 0
Challenge time: 19.000

Speed Stacker!

This level can be annoying(see the puzzle wing if you're stuck), but I believe it's worth including because it is the first use of the Ember Machine (TM) which I am very proud of. The Ember Machine (TM) forces you to collect unpinned blocks throughout the level to build up to the finish at the end.

Execution difficulty: 9
Puzzle difficulty: 2

Jump to 3000 deco!

This level was my submission to a level jam that was held when the Boxel Community hit 3000 members. The winner of this level jam was "5 years of boxel," which you are likely to have played in the community pack. (see history wing for full story) The level has references to Boxel Rebound and Tiny Tycoon. This level is also part of my standalone puzzle series, so you will find a version without deco later in the pack. You should try playing that if you are stuck, and then if you are still stuck, check the puzzle wing for a hint.

Execution difficulty: 2
Puzzle difficulty: 2
